meanings.definition: Existing or occurring across different periods of history.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a transhistorical collection of artifacts from various time periods.
meanings.sent2: The concept of love is transhistorical, as it has been written about in every era.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to imagine a transhistorical fashion show with outfits from different historical periods.
meanings.sent4: Her transhistorical knowledge of art allowed her to appreciate paintings from any time period.
meanings.sent5: The transhistorical bond between siblings is a timeless connection that transcends generations.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of all historical periods.
meanings.sent1: The philosopher's transhistorical ideas influenced thinkers throughout history.
meanings.sent2: The belief in human rights is a transhistorical value that societies have strived to uphold.
meanings.sent3: It would be amusing to see a transhistorical figure trying to navigate modern technology.
meanings.sent4: The transhistorical impact of Shakespeare's plays can still be felt today.
meanings.sent5: The transhistorical struggle for equality has been a constant theme in the fight for justice.

meanings.definition: Not limited by or confined to a particular historical time period.
meanings.sent1: The artist's transhistorical style drew inspiration from diverse historical eras.
meanings.sent2: The idea of freedom is transhistorical, relevant in all epochs of human history.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to picture a transhistorical character attending a modern-day party.
meanings.sent4: Her transhistorical perspective allowed her to see beyond the constraints of time.
meanings.sent5: The transhistorical nature of music means that melodies can resonate across centuries.
